TopicTitle: Saitek X55 Rhino axis management issues in KSP

Articles.Content: I have been using a Saitek X55 Rhino HOTAS for the past ~6 months.  In KSP version 1.0.1 and earlier, there were no issues with this HOTAS.  I didn't play versions 1.0.2 and 1.0.3, so I don't know if the problem was present in either of those versions.  However, since 1.0.4, the game sees the x and y axes of the joystick portion of the HOTAS as the same axes of the throttle portion of the HOTAS.  This has made the game unplayable for this HOTAS as full throttle will apply both full pitch and full yaw/roll in a direction depending on whether the y axis of the joystick is set as yaw or roll.  Will this ever be fixed?
The Advanced Fly By Wire mod is your only hope... my X-55 HOTAS is working perfectly now.
Thank you very much for the headsup with the mod, i will try that ;-)

Just so you know.

KSP v1.1.2 fixed this issue, X55 Rhino is seen as this now : 

INPUT_DEVICES
{
	Saitek Pro Flight X-55 Rhino Stick = 1
	Saitek Pro Flight X-55 Rhino Throttle = 0
}

Instead of "Saitek Pro Flight X-55 R." for both Stick and Throttle.

So X55 should work with KSP now.

Thanks for the headsup... actual I reported that bug during the pre-testing so im very happy to hear the joystick now work  ;-)

- It is was as descriped an axis problem where the two joysticks ( trust and power joystick ) shared the same axis, and then funny things would happen.

Spoke too soon.

Axis are working as intended now, but I got major input lag with my X-55, whereas X360 gamepad is still fine.
